alert.note: Alert for Addison (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 14 at 5:38AM EDT until further notice by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Burlington VT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Vermont... Otter Creek At Middlebury affecting Addison County. For the Otter Creek...including Center Rutland, Middlebury...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Otter Creek at Middlebury. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 6.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning and continue rising to a crest of 7.8 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - At 7 feet...Creek Road and 3 Mile Bridge Road will flood. Water begins to threaten lower portions of businesses on Bakery Lane and a few homes on Seymour Street near the covered bridge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 545 PM EDT.
